verse: तदेष श्लोको भवति। यदा सर्वे प्रमुच्यन्ते कामा येऽस्य हृदि श्रिताः॥ अथ मर्त्योऽमृतो भवत्यत्र ब्रह्म समश्नुत इति॥ तद्यथाऽहिनिर्ल्वनी वल्मीके मृता प्रत्यस्ता शयीतैवमेवेद शरीर शेतेऽथायमशरीरोऽमृतः प्राणो ब्रह्मैव तेज एव सोऽहं भगवते सहस्रानि ददामीति होवाच जनको वैदेहः॥
meaning: This verse says, "When all desires residing in the heart are released, one attains immortality here (in this world) and becomes one with Brahman (the Ultimate Reality). Just as when the reflection of the sun is not extinguished in the water, but rather lies down again, similarly, the formless and immortal vital force resides in the body. I am that Supreme Being, the light itself. Thus said King Janaka to Sita, 'I offer thousands to the Divine.'"

upnishad-org.meaning: When all the desires that dwell in his heart are got rid of, then does the mortal man become immortal and attain Brahman in this very body.' "Just as the slough of a snake lies, dead and cast away, on an ant-hill, even so lies this body. Then the self becomes disembodied and immortal Spirit, the Supreme Self (Prana), Brahman, the Light."
